profile_description:
Vogue
The official Instagram of American Vogue
likeshop.me/voguemagazine

posts.description:
As Paris #Pride attendees marched to the Place de la République on the city’s Right Bank, the mood was alternately celebratory and somber; many denounced a new Hungarian law that bans the distribution of school materials deemed to promote homosexuality or trans identity, while other chanted, “Less talk, more rights.”

Tap the link in our bio to see more from the #Pride parade in Paris. Photographed by @francoislguillaume

When @sophiet and @joejonas tied the knot in 2019, their South of France wedding was shrouded in secrecy. The location was kept secret. Great lengths were taken to keep paparazzi out. Pictures on social media were few and far between. The only people who really knew anything about the affair were, well, the ones who attended it.

But on their second wedding anniversary, @sophiet finally felt ready to open up.

Tap the link in our bio to see inside their stunning celebration. Photos: @corbingurkin

Raised on a cattle ranch in her native Uruguay and married to a scion of one of the most storied families in America, @gabrielahearst, who founded her eponymous label in 2015, has come to embody a certain kind of intelligent, sustainable luxury. She communicates an urgency around the climate crisis—but she does so with elegance, joie de vivre, and something of a frontier spirit. Hearst’s mandate at @chloe is to bring a current of engagé environmentalism and purpose to a house—previously led by the likes of Karl Lagerfeld, Stella McCartney, and Phoebe Philo—known for a vision of carefree yet clever French femininity.

Tap the link in our bio to read how @gabrielahearst is ushering in a new era at @chloe. Photographed by @zoeghertner, styled by #CamillaNickerson, Vogue 2021

"Most of the time, I don't think about skipping prom at all; after all, I'm 27 years old, with a well-rounded social life, and the only time prom really comes up is when I see the news of some super-elaborate promposal on Twitter and think to myself, 'Thank God I went to high school before people started asking each other to prom on pizzas and via singing telegram,'" shares one Vogue writer. "When I heard that pop phenom @oliviarodrigo would be holding a prom-themed livestream event, I felt a surprising twinge of melancholy; had I made a mistake missing out on that particular rite of passage?"

Tap the link in our bio to read more.

Last night’s @MarcJacobs show was a comeback of multiple kinds. What we got for this new “new beginning” was @MarcJacobs couture, a bold statement about the dynamism and allure of dramatic mid-century proportions filtered through an American sportswear vernacular and put together with an eye to the assemblage style and rule-breaking of Gen Z.

Tap the link in our bio to see the full collection.

“When I became second lady—and there was so much I wanted to do—I always said, ‘I will never waste this platform,’ ” explains @drbiden, who traveled to nearly 40 countries as second lady. “And now I have a bigger platform,” @drbiden says, “and I feel every day, like....What could I give up? That I would want to give up? Nothing. If anything, I feel like adding more things, but I know it’s not possible, because you want to stay centered, because you want to do things well. And there’s so much to do. There is...so. Much. To. Do.”

Tap the link in our bio to read our full profile on @flotus @drbiden for our August issue. Photographed by @annieleibovitz, styled by @tonnegood, written by @jonathanvanmeter, Vogue, August 2021

@drbiden was hesitant to take on the “role of the wife of the United States senator,” @joebiden says—even as she would campaign by his side in those Senate years. “But it was clear to me that she knew exactly what she would do if she were first lady. And so she came in, I think—knowing the experience of being vice president, knowing the power of the presidency—knowing that she could change things.” He remembers the first time she spoke in front of a truly big crowd, “and I was like, That’s my girl. So proud. She would just go do it, and she got better and better. And she started saying, ‘Joe, you gotta put a little more emotion into what you’re doing.’ ”

Tap the link in our bio to read our full profile on @drbiden for our August issue. Photographed by @annieleibovitz, styled by @tonnegood, written by @jonathanvanmeter, Vogue, August 2021

#Pride Month is ever-so-slowly drawing to a close, but you wouldn’t have known it from the scene on the streets of New York this past weekend. There were dozens of celebrations, rallies, and events, from Saturday’s Dyke March to Sunday’s Queer Liberation March, NYC Pride Parade and The Stonewall Protests at Rashid Johnson’s Red Stage—and photographer Ryan McGinley was on hand to capture the scene at many of them. Tap the link in our bio to see more. Photographed by @ryanmcginleystudios

1 @glits_inc 
2 & 3 @nycpride
4 @dragonflyneptunite @thestonewallprotests 5 @queermarch 6 @joelriveraaa @thestonewallprotests  7 @queermarch @pride_puppets

Fashion at the #BETAwards is bold. The annual celebration of Black excellence is all about exuberant style and last night’s event was no exception—starting with the show's fabulous host, @tarajiphenson. With multiple outfit changes, hairstyles, and beauty looks, Henson kept the party going while paying tribute to the Black Hollywood icons who’ve inspired her. The clothes were on point, her beauty transformations jaw-dropping—and we got the scoop on how she pulled it off.

At the link in our bio, an exclusive behind-the-scenes look at how Henson's looks came together. Photo: @cibellelevi
